choices.A: Yes, because the senior supplier is responsible for the final acceptance of all project products.
choices.D: No, because the consultant is responsible for agreeing the requirements for the ‘e-learning course’.
choices.B: Yes, because the consultant has the necessary experience to review the ‘e-learning course’.
choices.C: No, because members of the project board cannot be involved in quality reviews in the reviewer role.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In PRINCE2, the senior supplier is typically responsible for ensuring that the quality of the project's products meets the required standards and that they are delivered to the necessary specifications. Since the consultant was contracted to design the e-learning course, they likely possess the relevant expertise and knowledge about the course’s design, making them a good candidate to review it after the development phase.

questions.question_text:
QUALITY -
An independent consultant had been contracted to design the ‘e-learning course’ and was appointed as a senior supplier on the project board. The design has now been completed and passed to another company to do the development work. The consultant has also has been asked to review the ‘e-learning course’ after it has been developed.
Is this appropriate, and why?

discussion.content: D is the correct answer, Fig 9.2

questions.question_text:
Having completed designing the plan, in which order should the next steps take place to produce a plan?
1. Prepare Estimates
2. Define and analyze Products
3. Prepare the schedule
4. Identify activities and dependencies

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
What was changed here is the frequency not the content and format. Since the question if refering to a stage it has to be C.

questions.question_text:
PROGRESS -
The project board has asked the project manager to produce highlight reports every two weeks during stage 4, as the project is near completion. The standard for the rest of the project was every four weeks.
Which statement explains why this is appropriate?

choices.C: The frequency of reporting should suit the level of risk and the products being created during the stage.
choices.A: The format and content of highlight reports should meet the information needs of the project board.
choices.B: Progress reports should be produced at the ad hoc request of the project board during a stage.
choices.D: The frequency of reporting should suit the level of risk and products being created within the work package.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
There are other factors to concider when deciding on stage length and complexity is one of them. The point of Finance Director is not appropriate to define a stage. Not sure..

choices.D: No, because the reports for the Finance Director should wait until the end of each stage.
choices.B: Yes, because one month is a sensible planning horizon for stages as well.
choices.A: Yes, because this approach will reduce the burden on senior management.
choices.C: No, because the choice of stages should consider the project complexity as well.

questions.question_text:
PRINCIPLES -
The Finance Director needs to gather information on the number of hours spent by staff on the Health and Safety Training Project, to calculate actual human resource cost. The corporate managers have to submit this information at the end of each month, along with an estimate for the following month. The Finance Director decides that the project stages will coincide with these corporate reporting periods to avoid duplication of work, and instructs the project board to take necessary measures.
Is this a CORRECT application of the ‘manage by stages’ principle, and why?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Figura 9.6 El enfoque para de¡nir y analizar los productos recomendado de PRINCE2

C

Option 2 (Identifying activities) is not a primary focus of product-based planning. It is more related to activity-based planning, which is a different aspect of project planning in PRINCE2.

Selected Answer: C
As per Fig 9.6, identifying activities is not a step for product based planning.

Selected Answer: A
As said product flow diagram is the only optional step here. Identifying Activities and Dependencies is a fundamental step coming immediately after the Defining and Analysing the Product step.
The product flow diagram (sequence) is optional

questions.question_text:
Product based planning focuses on which of the following:
1. Creating product descriptions
2. Identifying activities
3. Creating a Product hierarchy
4. Creating a Product sequence
